00173 // Macros used to ensure compatibility with ARM code.
00174 // ARM is a 32-bit machine, so it needs to declare a
00175 // temporary variable, which is guaranted to be on a
00176 // 32-bit boundary.  The AVR does not need to declare the
00177 // temporary variable, which saves flash space in the
00178 // AVR platforms.
00179 #define  DECLARE64(x) u64 ad = (x)
00180 #define  USE64(x)   (&ad)
